snippet: Expenses for reorganization hurt net income, and political advertising helped revenue grow in the October-December quarter.
abstract: Gannett reports fourth-quarter profit of $103.1 million, or 44 cents a share, down 12 percent from $116.9 million, or 49 cents a share, in year-ago quarter;  revenue rose to $1.52 billion from $1.39 billion on robust political advertising.
lead_paragraph: Expenses for reorganization hurt net income, and political advertising helped revenue grow in the October-December quarter.

headline.seo: Gannett Posts Lower Income but Higher Revenue
headline.main: Gannett Posts Lower Income on a Gain in Revenue
headline.print_headline: Gannett Posts Lower Income On a Gain In Revenue
